SEARCH
Package Network

Class Server

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
Network.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Runnable, Remote, Server_RMI
public class Server extends UnicastRemoteObject implements Runnable, Server_RMI
The Server class represents a server for handling client connections and implementing remote method invocation (RMI). It extends the UnicastRemoteObject class and implements the Runnable and Server_RMI interfaces.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server(int defaultPort) throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new instance of the Server class.
      Parameters:
      defaultPort - The default port number to be used for the server.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there is an error in the remote method invocation.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the server and listens for incoming client connections. The server socket is created using the default port specified during server initialization. For each accepted client connection, a new SocketClientHandler is created and started in a separate thread. The method continues to listen for incoming connections until the current thread is interrupted. If an IOException occurs while accepting a client connection, the exception is printed.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • createLobby

      public int createLobby(int numPlayers, String creatorLobby, Message message, SocketClientHandler clientHandler)
      Creates a lobby with the specified number of players and creator's name. If there are any previous inactive lobbies, they are replaced by the new lobby. The lobby is added to the Lobby list, and a corresponding lobby-created message is added to the LobbyMessage list. The GameController is initialized with the number of players, server reference, and creator's name. The client handler for the lobby creator is added to the clientHandlerMap.
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - The number of players for the lobby.
      creatorLobby - The name of the lobby creator.
      message - The original message that triggered the lobby creation.
      clientHandler - The client handler associated with the lobby creator.
      Returns:
      The index of the created lobby in the Lobby list.

    • joinLobby

      public int joinLobby(Message message, SocketClientHandler clientHandler)
      Joins a lobby with the specified player name. If there is an available lobby that is not full, the player is added to that lobby. If no available lobby is found, a new 2-player lobby is created. The player is added to the lobby and a corresponding lobby-created message is added to the LobbyMessage list. The GameController is initialized with the server reference. The client handler for the player is added to the clientHandlerMap.
      Parameters:
      message - The message containing the player name.
      clientHandler - The client handler associated with the player.
      Returns:
      The index of the joined lobby in the Lobby list.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(String name, SocketClientHandler clientHandler, int index, int mult)
      Adds a player to the specified lobby with the given name and client handler.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player to be added.
      clientHandler - The client handler associated with the player.
      index - The index of the lobby where the player will be added.
      mult - Indicates whether the player needs to be added to the match (0) or not (1).

      Parameters:

      Throws:

    • checkGameStarting

      Parameters:
      message - The message indicating the lobby index.

    • pickableTiles

      Specified by:
      pickableTiles in interface Server_RMI
      Parameters:
